elements.title: Joseph Henry Gest (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that for fifteen years Joseph Henry Gest (pictured) was both the director of the Cincinnati Art Museum and the president of the Rookwood Pottery Company, spending mornings at one and afternoons at the other?

elements.title: Zack Kelly (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Zack Kelly received a $500 signing bonus, lost money in his first professional seasons, and was released by two organizations before he made his Major League Baseball debut?

elements.title: Jauchzet dem Herren, alle Welt (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jauchzet dem Herren, alle Welt by Heinrich Schütz, a 1619 setting of Psalm 100 for double choir, was performed at the Proms at the Royal Albert Hall in 1972?

elements.title: Samuel Fyzee-Rahamin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Samuel Fyzee-Rahamin was born a Jew, became a Muslim, moved to Pakistan and died in poverty?

elements.title: Troy axe murders (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in the Troy axe murders a former fireman killed his wife, five-year-old daughter, and five stepchildren and left love notes on their bodies?

elements.title: Tom Dorrien-Smith (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that whilst serving in the Royal Navy during World War II, Tom Dorrien-Smith, a former leaseholder of Tresco, was involved in the sinking of the Bismarck?

elements.title: Van Ness Bus Rapid Transit (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that construction of Van Ness Bus Rapid Transit uncovered tracks from the California Street Cable Railroad?

elements.title: warg (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in Norse mythology, the sun and moon are each chased by a warg?
